intro: Cirsium lanceolatum var. hypoleucum, commonly known as the paleleaf thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped, pale green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tall, spiny stems that bear purple to pink flower heads composed of numerous small florets. Its flowers typically bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is often found in dry meadows, grasslands, and along rocky slopes.
